Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Retail Clerks International Association, Local 1115E, Retail Furniture Employees Union Records
Retail Clerks International Association. Local 1115E (Retail Furniture Employees Union)
Hector, Adele Arico
WAG.277
0.25 Linear Feet In 1 manuscript box
1949-1962 Materials are in English The Retail Furniture Employees Union became a Local of the Retail Clerks International Association.The collection contains election materials, correspondence, fliers for protests, speeches, and a program for dinner and dance put on by the local. 1
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection, provenance is unknown but may have been donated by Adele Hector on behalf of the D'Angelo family. The accession number 1950.246 is associated with this collection.
Conditions Governing Use
The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1949-1962, are expected to enter the public domain in 2083.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Historical/Biographical Note
The Retail Furniture Employees Union became a Local of the Retail Clerks International Association.
Scope and Contents
This small collection contains some of the records of the Retail Furniture Employees Union which had become a Local of the Retail Clerks International Association. The collection contains election materials, correspondence, fliers for protests, speeches, and a program for dinner and dance put on by the local.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Retail Clerks International Association, Local 1115E, Retail Furniture Employees Union Records; WAG 277; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Furniture industry and trade |z United States. Hector, Adele Arico
